fields.name: reservoir_heat_capacity
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock heat capacity. The heat capacity of the geothermal fluid. This parameter determines how much energy can be stored in the fluid as its temperature changes.

fields.name: reservoir_density
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock density. The density of the geothermal fluid in the reservoir. This parameter affects the fluid's buoyancy and flow behavior, which can in turn affect the overall performance of the geothermal system.

fields.name: reservoir_thermal_conductivity
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock thermal conductivity. The thermal conductivity of the geothermal rock or other material surrounding the reservoir. This parameter affects how efficiently heat can be transferred from the hot fluid in the reservoir to the surrounding rock, which can impact the overall energy output of the system.

fields.name: min_reservoir_depth
fields.description: This input variable specifies the minimum depth of the geothermal reservoir in kilometers.

fields.name: max_reservoir_depth
fields.description: This input variable specifies the maximum depth of the geothermal reservoir  in kilometers.

fields.name: min_production_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the minimum number of (identical) wells that can be used to extract fluid from the geothermal reservoir. Note: The configuration only allows doublet (1:1 production to injection) an triplet (2:1 production to injection).

fields.name: max_production_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the maximum number of (identical) wells that can be used to extract fluid from the geothermal reservoir. Note: The configuration only allows doublet (1:1 production to injection) an triplet (2:1 production to injection).

fields.name: min_injection_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the minimum number of (identical) wells that can be used to inject fluid into the geothermal reservoir.

fields.name: max_injection_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the maximum number of (identical) wells that can be used to inject fluid into the geothermal reservoir.

fields.name: gradient_1
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 1. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad1
fields.description: Defines the thickness is kilometers of gradient #1

fields.name: gradient_2
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 2. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad2
fields.description: Defines the thickness is kilometers of gradient #2

fields.name: gradient_3
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 3. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad3
fields.description: Defines the thickness is kilometers of gradient #3

fields.name: gradient_4
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 4 (until final depth). No segment thickness is necessary as input. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: fracture_shape
fields.description: This parameter defines the shape of fractures within the geothermal reservoir, a critical factor in determining the flow and extraction efficiency of geothermal fluids

fields.name: fracture_height
fields.description: Specifies the height of fractures within the geothermal reservoir

fields.name: number_of_fractures
fields.description: This input defines the total number of fractures engineered or naturally occurring within the geothermal reservoir, affecting the system's overall fluid flow and heat extraction capabilities.

fields.name: well_drilling_cost_correlation
fields.description: Determines the cost relationship for drilling wells in the geothermal project, offering a range of correlation options to best match the project's specific conditions and financial modeling. Select the built-in horizontal well drilling and completion cost correlation: 1: Vertical Small Diameter, Baseline; 2: Vertical Small Diameter, Intermediate1; 3: Vertical Small Diameter, Intermediate2; 4: Vertical Small Diameter, Ideal; 5: Deviated Small Diameter, Baseline; 6: Deviated Small Diameter, Intermediate1; 7: Deviated Small Diameter, Intermediate2; 8: Deviated Small Diameter, Ideal; 9: Vertical Large Diameter, Baseline; 10: Vertical Large Diameter, Intermediate1; 11: Vertical Large Diameter, Intermediate2; 12: Vertical Large Diameter, Ideal; 13: Deviated Large Diameter, Baseline; 14: Deviated Large Diameter, Intermediate1; 15: Deviated Large Diameter, Intermediate2; 16: Deviated Large Diameter, Ideal 17: Simple - user specified cost per meter

fields.name: target_prod_temp_min
fields.description: Sets the minimum target temperature for fluid production in the geothermal system

fields.name: target_prod_temp_max
fields.description: Sets the maximum target temperature for fluid production in the geothermal system

fields.name: production_well_diameter
fields.description: Sets the production well diameter. Depending on the size of the well, well drilling cost correlation will have to be adjusted to ensure that the cost correlation is consistent with either large or small diameter cost correlations

fields.name: injection_well_diameter
fields.description: Sets the injection well diameter. Depending on the size of the well, well drilling cost correlation will have to be adjusted to ensure that the cost correlation is consistent with either large or small diameter cost correlations

fields.name: lifetime
fields.description: This parameter specifies the expected operational lifespan of the EGS Combined Heat and Power project.

fields.name: interest_rate
fields.description: Specifies the interest rate during the project lifecycle

fields.name: electricity_rate
fields.description: Specifies the cost of electricity

fields.name: max_elec_gen_kwe
fields.description: Sets the upper limit on the total electricity that can be generated.

fields.name: elec_cap_vs_surface_cost
fields.description: Outlines the initial investment required for surface facilities in relation to the electrical output.

fields.name: elec_cap_vs_surface_om_cost
fields.pretty_name: Surface O&M Cost to Electric Slope
fields.description: Indicates the operating and maintenance costs associated with surface facilities per unit of electricity generated.

fields.name: max_therm_ext_kwth
fields.description: Determines maximum output at which heat can be extracted from the geothermal reservoir.

fields.name: therm_cap_vs_reservoir_cost
fields.description: Defines the initial cost gradient for developing subsurface components based on thermal energy production capacity,.

fields.name: therm_cap_vs_reservoir_om_cost
fields.pretty_name: Subsurface O&M Cost to Thermal Slope
fields.description: Represents the operating and maintenance cost gradient for subsurface components relative to thermal output

fields.name: elec_prod_to_therm_ext_ratio
fields.description: Average thermal production as a ratio of the electric production output

fields.name: heat_prod_to_therm_ext_ratio
fields.description: Average thermal production as a ratio of the heat production output

fields.name: therm_ext_to_therm_ext_ratio
fields.description: Average thermal production

Select the built-in horizontal well drilling and completion cost correlation: 1: Vertical Small Diameter, Baseline; 2: Vertical Small Diameter, Intermediate1; 3: Vertical Small Diameter, Intermediate2; 4: Vertical Small Diameter, Ideal; 5: Deviated Small Diameter, Baseline; 6: Deviated Small Diameter, Intermediate1; 7: Deviated Small Diameter, Intermediate2; 8: Deviated Small Diameter, Ideal; 9: Vertical Large Diameter, Baseline; 10: Vertical Large Diameter, Intermediate1; 11: Vertical Large Diameter, Intermediate2; 12: Vertical Large Diameter, Ideal; 13: Deviated Large Diameter, Baseline; 14: Deviated Large Diameter, Intermediate1; 15: Deviated Large Diameter, Intermediate2; 16: Deviated Large Diameter, Ideal 17: Simple - user specified cost per meter

fields.name: target_prod_temp_min
fields.description: Sets the minimum target temperature for fluid production in the geothermal system

fields.name: target_prod_temp_max
fields.description: Sets the maximum target temperature for fluid production in the geothermal system

fields.name: production_well_diameter
fields.description: Sets the production well diameter. Depending on the size of the well, well drilling cost correlation will have to be adjusted to ensure that the cost correlation is consistent with either large or small diameter cost correlations

fields.name: injection_well_diameter
fields.description: Sets the injection well diameter. Depending on the size of the well, well drilling cost correlation will have to be adjusted to ensure that the cost correlation is consistent with either large or small diameter cost correlations

fields.name: lifetime
fields.description: This parameter specifies the expected operational lifespan of the EGS Combined Heat and Power project.

fields.name: interest_rate
fields.description: Specifies the interest rate during the project lifecycle

fields.name: electricity_rate
fields.description: Specifies the cost of electricity

fields.name: max_therm_ext_kwth
fields.description: Determines maximum output at which heat can be extracted from the geothermal reservoir.

fields.name: therm_cap_vs_reservoir_cost
fields.description: Defines the initial cost gradient for developing subsurface components based on thermal energy production capacity,.

fields.name: therm_cap_vs_reservoir_om_cost
fields.pretty_name: Subsurface O&M Cost to Thermal Slope
fields.description: Represents the operating and maintenance cost gradient for subsurface components relative to thermal output

fields.name: heat_prod_to_therm_ext_ratio
fields.description: Average thermal production as a ratio of the electric production output

fields.name: reservoir_heat_capacity
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock heat capacity. The heat capacity of the geothermal fluid. This parameter determines how much energy can be stored in the fluid as its temperature changes.

fields.name: reservoir_density
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock density. The density of the geothermal fluid in the reservoir. This parameter affects the fluid's buoyancy and flow behavior, which can in turn affect the overall performance of the geothermal system.

fields.name: reservoir_thermal_conductivity
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock thermal conductivity. The thermal conductivity of the geothermal rock or other material surrounding the reservoir. This parameter affects how efficiently heat can be transferred from the hot fluid in the reservoir to the surrounding rock, which can impact the overall energy output of the system.

fields.name: min_reservoir_depth
fields.description: This input variable specifies the minimum depth of the geothermal reservoir in kilometers.

fields.name: max_reservoir_depth
fields.description: This input variable specifies the maximum depth of the geothermal reservoir  in kilometers.

fields.name: min_production_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the minimum number of (identical) wells that can be used to extract fluid from the geothermal reservoir. Note: The configuration only allows doublet (1:1 production to injection) an triplet (2:1 production to injection).

fields.name: max_production_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the maximum number of (identical) wells that can be used to extract fluid from the geothermal reservoir. Note: The configuration only allows doublet (1:1 production to injection) an triplet (2:1 production to injection).

fields.name: min_injection_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the minimum number of (identical) wells that can be used to inject fluid into the geothermal reservoir.

fields.name: max_injection_wells
fields.description: This input variable specifies the maximum number of (identical) wells that can be used to inject fluid into the geothermal reservoir.

fields.name: gradient_1
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 1. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad1
fields.description: Defines the thickness is kilometers of gradient #1

fields.name: gradient_2
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 2. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad2
fields.description: Defines the thickness is kilometers of gradient #2

fields.name: gradient_3
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 3. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad3
fields.description: Defines the thickness is kilometers of gradient #3

fields.name: gradient_4
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 4 (until final depth). No segment thickness is necessary as input. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.description: This input variable specifies the maximum number of (identical) wells that can be used to inject fluid into the geothermal reservoir.

fields.name: gradient_1
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 1. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad1
fields.description: Defines the thickness is kilometers of gradient #1

fields.name: gradient_2
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 2. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: thickness_grad3

fields.name: gradient_4
fields.description: Defines temperature gradient of subsurface segment 4 (until final depth). No segment thickness is necessary as input. The gradient refers to the rate at which the temperature of the geothermal reservoir rock segment changes with depth. A higher gradient indicates a more rapid increase in temperature with depth, which can potentially yield higher temperatures and, thus, more energy.

fields.name: well_drilling_cost_correlation
fields.description: Determines the cost relationship for drilling wells in the geothermal project, offering a range of correlation options to best match the project's specific conditions and financial modeling. Select the built-in horizontal well drilling and completion cost correlation: 1: Vertical Small Diameter, Baseline; 2: Vertical Small Diameter, Intermediate1; 3: Vertical Small Diameter, Intermediate2; 4: Vertical Small Diameter, Ideal; 5: Deviated Small Diameter, Baseline; 6: Deviated Small Diameter, Intermediate1; 7: Deviated Small Diameter, Intermediate2; 8: Deviated Small Diameter, Ideal; 9: Vertical Large Diameter, Baseline; 10: Vertical Large Diameter, Intermediate1; 11: Vertical Large Diameter, Intermediate2; 12: Vertical Large Diameter, Ideal; 13: Deviated Large Diameter, Baseline; 14: Deviated Large Diameter, Intermediate1; 15: Deviated Large Diameter, Intermediate2; 16: Deviated Large Diameter, Ideal 17: Simple - user specified cost per meter

fields.name: reservoir_heat_capacity
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock heat capacity. The heat capacity of the geothermal fluid. This parameter determines how much energy can be stored in the fluid as its temperature changes.

fields.name: reservoir_density
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock density. The density of the geothermal fluid in the reservoir. This parameter affects the fluid's buoyancy and flow behavior, which can in turn affect the overall performance of the geothermal system.

fields.name: reservoir_thermal_conductivity
fields.description: Constant and uniform reservoir rock thermal conductivity. The thermal conductivity of the geothermal rock or other material surrounding the reservoir. This parameter affects how efficiently heat can be transferred from the hot fluid in the reservoir to the surrounding rock, which can impact the overall energy output of the system.
